New Records: Australia recorded their second-highest successful chase in T20I cricket
Key Match Events: Cameron Green blitzed a 26-ball half-century in his first innings as an opener in professional cricket
Matthew Wade accelerated in the end overs to ice the chase, with four balls and four wickets to spare
Green unleashed some Mitchell Marsh-style slog-sweeps during his 30-ball 61
Hardik Pandya struck a rapid 30-ball 71 not out to propel India beyond 200
Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Harshal Patel ended with combined figures of 8-0-101-0
Axar Patel then applied the brakes on Australia with figures of 3 for 17 in his four overs
Post-Match Reflections: Australia won the first T20I by 4 wickets (with 4 balls remaining)
India stay true to their attacking approach
Although both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli fell early, India kept attacking through KL Rahul, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya
Miscellaneous Highlights: The placid track, a lighting-quick outfield and incredible ball-striking formed the ingredients of a Hardik special
Green might not have even played had Marsh or Marcus Stoinis been fit, but he seized his opportunity
Wade alone hit 45 off 29 balls, to expose India's death bowling
Others: India's bowling a concern heading into the T20 World Cup
Australia's second-highest successful chase in T20I cricket
